TempSED 0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Reference

    All functions

    air_properties() air_density() air_humidity() air_vapor() air_tc() air_cp() air_td()

    Properties of the air relevant for sediment temperature modelling.

    bulk_properties() bulk_density() bulk_tc() bulk_cp() bulk_td()

    Properties of the bulk sediment.

    flux_heat() flux_latent() flux_evaporation() flux_sensible() flux_backradiation()

    Heat fluxes between the air and sediment (positive = into sediment).

    mineral_properties() mineral_density() mineral_tc() mineral_cp() mineral_td()

    Properties of the major sediment-constituent minerals.

    trunc_function()

    Utility functions for use with the TempSED models. Creates a truncated sinewave type of function.

    ForcingOS DataOS

    Forcings, initial conditions, and sediment data from the Oosterschelde in 2020

    TempSED_getparms() TempSED_getdepth() TempSED_getgrid() TempSED_getdx() TempSED_getpor() TempSED_getirr()

    Functions to retrieve parameters, porosity, depth and sediment grid, irrigation and bioturbation, for the TempSED model.

    TempSED_get0Dvars() TempSED_get1Dvars() TempSED_getstates()

    Functions to retrieve variables for the TempSED model.

    TempSED-package TempSED

    A package to model temperature in aquatic sediments.

    image2D(<TempSEDdyn>) matplot0D() matplot1D() plot(<TempSEDdyn>)

    Utility functions for plotting sediment temperature dynamic model output.

    TempSED_run1D()

    Dynamic solution of sediment temperature in one vertical Dimension.

    water_properties() water_density() water_cp() water_tc() water_td() water_lh()

    Properties of the water relevant for sediment temperature modelling.

    Contents
